entry.title: The Maillard Reaction
entry.content:
(Source from http://healthyeating.sfgate.com/difference-between-sucrose-glucose-fructose-8704.html)



non-enzymatic browning 
a chemical process that produces a brown color in foods without the activity of enzymes.
-> two forms: caramelization, mailard reaction 
caramelization:
reaction between sugars and sugars
maillard reaction:
reaction between sugars and amino acids
    amino acid:
    


enzyme
(n. 酶)


caramel(焦糖)
caramelize(v.)


Sucrose(蔗糖) = X*glucose(葡萄糖) + Y*fruitcose(果糖)









Structure

Simple carbohydrates are classified as either monosaccharides or disaccharides. Monosaccharides are the simplest, most basic units of carbohydrates and are made up of only one sugar unit. Glucose and fructose are monosaccharides and are the building blocks of sucrose, a disaccharide. Thus, disaccharides are just a pair of linked sugar molecules. They are formed when two monosaccharides are joined together and a molecule of water is removed -- a dehydration reaction.

Glucose

The most important monosaccharide is glucose, the body’s preferred energy source. Glucose is also called blood sugar, as it circulates in the blood, and relies on the enzymes glucokinase or hexokinase to initiate metabolism. Your body processes most carbohydrates you eat into glucose, either to be used immediately for energy or to be stored in muscle cells or the liver as glycogen for later use. Unlike fructose, insulin is secreted primarily in response to elevated blood concentrations of glucose, and insulin facilitates the entry of glucose into cells.

Fructose

Fructose is a sugar found naturally in many fruits and vegetables, and added to various beverages such as soda and fruit-flavored drinks. However, it is very different from other sugars because it has a different metabolic pathway and is not the preferred energy source for muscles or the brain. Fructose is only metabolized in the liver and relies on fructokinase to initiate metabolism. It is also more lipogenic, or fat-producing, than glucose. Unlike glucose, too, it does not cause insulin to be released or stimulate production of leptin, a key hormone for regulating energy intake and expenditure. These factors raise concerns about chronically high intakes of dietary fructose, because it appears to behave more like fat in the body than like other carbohydrates.

Sucrose

Sucrose is commonly known as table sugar, and is obtained from sugar cane or sugar beets. Fruits and vegetables also naturally contain sucrose. When sucrose is consumed, the enzyme beta-fructosidase separates sucrose into its individual sugar units of glucose and fructose. Both sugars are then taken up by their specific transport mechanisms. The body responds to the glucose content of the meal in its usual manner; however, fructose uptake occurs at the same time. The body will use glucose as its main energy source and the excess energy from fructose, if not needed, will be poured into fat synthesis, which is stimulated by the insulin released in response to glucose.

entry.title: Ch19 Searching and Sorting
entry.content:
19.2 Searching Algorithms

Big(O)

O(1)
situation:
to test whether the first element of a vector is equal to the second element in the same vector
-> when the n(lenght) of the vector grows, it doesn't affect the time this algorithm needs

O(n)
situation:
to test whether the first element of a vector is equal to any of the other elements of the vector
-> this algorithm requires (n-1) comparisons

O(n平方)
situation:
to test whether any element of a vector is duplicated elsewhere in the vector
-> this algorithm needs to compare the first element via (n-1) comparisons;
                                                         the second element via (n-2) comparison;
                                                         ......
-> total # of comparisons: (n-1) + (n-2) + (n-3) + .... + 2 + 1 = {((n-1) + 1)*(n-1)}/2 = n平方/2 - n/2


O(log n)
Binary Search
if there is a vector of 1023 (2的10次方-1)
    -> 最多只要10 times，就能找到要的值
if there is a vector of 1,048,575 (2的20次方-1)
    -> 最多只要20 times，就能找到要的值

Therefore, the maximum # of comparison is : log2 n
-> O(log n)




※註: 為何最後可直接用O(log n)，而不是用O(log2 n)
log base doesn't matter; the base is convertible
log2(n) = log10(n)/log10(2)
Since log10(2) is just const number, it can be omitted.



19.3 Sorting Algorithms

Selection Sorting

entry.title: const at the end of a class's member function
entry.content:
(source from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3141087/what-is-meant-with-const-at-end-of-function-declaration )



深入了解：

其實我們在call function時，會implicitly input the current memory address of the class into that function as the first argument
一般宣告：void Foo::Bar02(int random_arg)
其實在系統中是這樣的:
void Foo::Bar02(Foo* this, int random_arg)

如果宣告const:  void Foo::Bar02(int random_arg) const
其實在系統中是這樣的:
void Foo::Bar02(const Foo* this, int random_arg)
-> 此*this指標被宣告成const，自然不能改變他所指到的記憶體位址的內容了

entry.title: Hanoi 河內塔
entry.content:
myCodes






思考觀念：
不要想太多，每次都用兩層概念來想就好：
If N = 3;
一個3在BEGIN，要到END
那麼在3上面的2就要先讓開，並且去到不是END的地方->MIDDLE
一旦2移開，3就可以順利移到END去了
---- 3已移到END去 ----
現在要把2疊回到3的上面，
2現在的開始位置就是上次移動的最後位置，
2現在要去的最後位置也就是3上次移動的最後位置
想到這裡就OK了

那2移開了嗎?
好，那我們再來看2:
現在N = N - 1 = 2;
一個2在BEGIN，要到END
那麼在2上面的1就要先讓開，並且去到不是END的地方->MIDDLE
一旦1移開，2就可以順利移到END去了
---- 2已移到END去 ----
現在要把1疊回到2的上面，
1現在的開始位置就是上次移動的最後位置，
1現在要去的最後位置也就是2上次移動的最後位置
(完全一樣的流程)

那1移開了嗎?
因為1是最小的那個，又是最上面那個，
所以1想要移到哪就移到哪，
所以1就直接移到他想去的END位置。(這個END位置是由上一層決定的~)

RE

*caution：Even after a pointer ,which is previously allocated a block of memory by malloc, is freed by free function, the pointer still points to the same memory location. It's just the pointer is not anymore allocated with a block of memory (no guarantee that no newly-allocated memory will overlap current memory anymore).

entry.title: 50/50 (movie)
entry.content:
source from http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/5050-2011





After surgery and treatment, Reiser is currently in the sixth year of remission and cheerfully observes, "Remission apparently lasts forever … or until you die." In an interview by Jen Chaney with the two of them in the Washington Post, they joke endlessly, which is perhaps inevitable between a comedy writer and a comic actor, and although "50/50" is structured with the efficiency of a sitcom, there's an undercurrent of truth and real feeling.
Adam turns to his best buddy for support and encouragement. Kyle rises to the occasion, unlike Rachael (Bryce Dallas Howard), his girlfriend, who (as he learns) wasn't all that committed even before the awful diagnosis. Rachael of course vows to stand by and help him, as society says we must do, but in fact, cancer is a messy and depressing business, and she signed on to be a girlfriend, not a nurse. She doesn't have the right stuff. And believe me, the challenges Adam presents for her in "50/50" are nothing compared to real life. If you've been involved in the case of a loved one with cancer, you'll observe that this girl gets off easy.
Adam is also supported, maybe too much, by his mother, Diane (Anjelica Huston), who actually moves into his house. Her husband has Alzheimer's, and she's stuck by him, so she has the right stuff, but when you're sick, you need quiet time and the constant presence of a determined mother is not always what's called for.
The movie places Adam in a cancer patients' support group, where fellow patient Alan (Philip Baker Hall) provides dry, realistic input. Alan is a model of acceptance, the fifth stage in Elisabeth Kübler-Ross' "Five Stages of Grief." His work here is a reminder of what an effective actor Hall always is. Anna Kendrick plays Katherine, Adam's therapist, who gets just as involved as his oncologist is aloof. I know therapists are supposed to observe a certain distance, but in a case like this, I don't see how one can. I would make a terrible therapist.
The screenplay perhaps benefits from Reiser's experience on TV and proceeds in an orderly way through a basic sitcom structure. Some of the comedy aspects may seem unlikely, but Seth Rogen has a winning way about him and reveals genuine affection. If a movie like this were as relentlessly realistic as a masterpiece like Mike Nichols' "Wit," it would probably not be commercial and end up, as "Wit" did, on HBO. A spoonful of sugar helps the medicine go down.
What I appreciated was the third act. Sitcoms and film comedies in general have a way of going haywire with comic desperation toward the end. This one doesn't. Director Jonathan Levine ("The Wackness") has established the characters with enough care that the audience is prepared when they reveal greater depth toward the end. Anjelica Huston is especially good at breaking free of what seem to be the boundaries of her role.
"50/50" isn't completely true to life, but the more you know about cancer, the less you want it to be. Like another recent feel-good film about the disease, Gus Van Sant's "Restless," it creates a comforting myth. That's one of the things movies are good for.


haywire
(adj. out of control)

aloof
(adj. distant and cool)

Anna Kendrick

一、 如何充電？ 
1. NB電池充電只有一個方法,將電池裝入電腦中,插上電源供應器,即開始充電. 
2. 充電時間約在4~8 小時之間,視電池容量及各廠設計而有所不同,充電完成後,即 充電指示燈熄滅或轉成綠燈,最好將電源供應器拔除 
3. 最好不要間歇充電, 即電源供應器不要在短時間內來回插拔. 
4. 最好在關機狀況下充電. 
5. 不要混用變壓器或電源供應器,每種電子產品的工作電壓或充電電壓可能不同,使用錯誤可能使電池毀損,嚴重的還會使機器燒壞 
二、 如何使用？ 
1. 若長時間使用電源供應器做為電源供應, 建議取下電池, 單獨用電源供應器操作,需外出使用NB時再裝入電池使用 
2. 目前NB電池多採用鋰離子電池為主, 其最大優點就是沒有記憶效應, 所以使用者不必擔心此問題, 若電力沒有用完也可以充電, 但建議使用者偶爾將電池用至系統警告電力不足, 再執行充電, 對電池使用的可靠度有所幫助 
3. 不要將電池組作為其它電源使用 
三、如何保存電池？ 
1. 電池取下不用時,不要放置於高溫的環境中,如:太陽直射的汽車內或火源旁邊. 
2. 使用適當的容器,如紙盒儲放電池,電池的輸出金屬端子嚴禁與金屬物質接觸. 
3. 若長期不使用電池,應將電池充電約60~80%保存, 並定期取出使用,以保持電池的化學活性, 最好約1個月就將電池做一次充放電,然後再充電保存 
4. 電池內為精密的電子零件及電池芯組成, 避免電池掉落地面及重物敲擊. 
電池組故障排除 
若電池組發生以下狀況: 
1. 無法充電 
2. 無法充電至90%以上 
3. 很快就充飽電,且使用時間也很短. 
4. 電力指示接近滿載,但只能用數十分鐘就沒電 
請依照下列指示: 
1. 首先確定您的作業系統中,電源管理的設定正常.以Windows系統來說,控制台內有一個電源選項,請先確定設定無誤. 
2. 有些廠牌機種會設計具有電池自我校正功能程式,有些會在控制台-電源選項中可以找到,有些會內建在BIOS的設定中,遵照指示執行該程式,電池會經由此校正程式,恢復正常.(各廠排及型號有所不同,請參考您的NB使用手冊) 
3. 若您的NB沒有電池自我校正功能,您可依下步驟來校正電池: 
a.先將電池充飽電: 充電時不要開機,直接接上電源供應器充電,直到電腦指示燈號轉為充飽電為止. 
b.拔除電源供應器,(轉為使用電池)將電腦開機,"此時先不管電池電量計為多少". 
c.您可依正常方式使用電腦,或者撥放音樂或VCD影片,加速電池放電速度,直到電腦警告電力不足為止 
d.將電腦關機,依照步驟 1)方式進行. 
e.同步驟 b. 查看電池電量計是否回到95~100%之間.若電量回到95~100%之間,電池就正常沒有問題. 
若電量仍然偏低,請再重覆a~e步驟一次. 
若以上都無法解決電池使用不正常的狀況, 那電池組硬體故障的機率就很大了,可能須要送修,才能解決 
結語： 
現在幾乎所有的NB電池都使用鋰離子電池為主,且電池內有電源管理IC,來管理監控電池的使用狀況,並且記錄電池使用的各項資料,但有時後隨著使用次數的增加,或使用不當,這些管理電池的資料會出現誤差,所以就必須靠電池自我校正,來恢復正常使用,簡單的說,電池自我校正就是將電池做一次完整的充電及放電,在充電或放電的過程中不要中斷,靠著電源管理IC的作用,電池會自我調整至最佳的使用狀態 
但是電池本身為一種消耗品,隨著使用次數增加,電池的蓄電力會逐次減少,充放電循環壽大約在500 次上下,以時間估算,若您每天使用,大約1~2年之間您就該換一組新電池了,如果靠電池自我校正方式,是無法改變電池因使用,而產生化學材料老化的事實

entry.title: Ch10 Classes: A Deeper Look, Part 2
entry.content:
10.2  const Objects and const Member Function



const member function

purpose: to prevent modification of certain objects

how to define:
increment.cpp

Rule1:
non-const member function can not be used by const object
(non-const member function -> non-const object)

Rule2:
const member function can not modify anything.






*note: constructor and destructor are allowed to modify const objects. (exception)


const Data Member


*note:
const data member must be initialized by member initializer, seeing that const data member can't not be assigned values via =.


*補充: void Increment::print() const{ }
why declared this function const?
normally, we won't define an const increment object. However, when we pass a increment object to a function as an argument or returned by function, we might use a const reference or a pointer to const. If we don't declare const to the function Increment::print(), we can't not use it for these references and pointers. (since the function is non-const, so it can't be used to const object)




10.3 Composition: Objects as Members of Classes



(Codes)

Employee::Employee( ..., ..., const Date &dateOfBirth, const Date &dateOfHire)
    : ..., ..., birthDate(dateOfBirth),hireDate(dateOfHire)
{
    ...;
}

purpose: pass objects of a class as arguments to the member-object's constructor
the method is called: member initializer
Question: We don't have a constructor for class Date that takes a parameter of type Date. How can it take the objects from Employee class's constructor?
    the compiler provides each class with a default copy constructor that copies each data member
    with the constructor's argument object into the corresponding member of the object being 
    initialized.



10.4: friend Functions and friend Classes (朋友關係)

Function: to let functions outside of a class to access the class's private data member directly without calling another public member function.
Purpose: Calling functions take time. If we want to run a program faster, we have to call fewer functions if possible.



*notice: no {} needed & must put a semicolon ; in the end when declaring friend function
  (like declaring a prototype)
*note: put friendship declaration first inside the class definition's body and d not precede them with any access specifier. (cuz public, protected, private is not relevant to friend declaration)
*not symmetric nor transitive:
  not symmetric: A is a friend of class B    does not mean B is a friend of A, too.
  not transitive: A is a friend of class B. B is a friend of class C does not mean A is a friend of class C



10.5 Using the this Pointer

purpose: to know the memory location of an object
*note: every object has access to its own address through a pointer called this.
*note: the this pointer is passed (by the compiler) as an implicit argument to each of the object's non-static member.

type:
1. a constant pointer to a constant object
2. a constant pointer to a non-constant object


Implicitly and Explicitly using this pointer




Cascaded Function Calls




*note: 為何要回傳 Time&(參照):
    因為這樣才會指回原來的記憶體位置。(如果回傳的是Time而已，compiler會創建出另一個object，並copy一份到新的object上，這樣會讓過程中更動的private data members不能延續使用。)



10.6 static Class Members

static variable

purpose: to keep values of variables even when they go out of scope




static member variables

must declare it explicitly before accessing it
(somehow like the static variable of a class is a design, and we need to make a static variable according to the design)
*note: static data member usually initialized outside of the body of class (exception: int or enum type can be initialized in the class definition)

*note:
static members exist even if no objects of the class have been instantiated! Much like global variables, they are created when the program starts, and destroyed when the program ends.
    *note:
        therefore, we know static member belong to class not to objects of a class
        *note:
        consequently, static member function doesn't have the this pointer since static member 
        function and static data member do not belong to any objects
*note:
static member function + const (X)
    compilation error: 
    contradiction: const qualifier means that  a function cannot modify the contents of the object in 
                         which it operates.
                         static member functions exist and operate independently of any objects of the 
                         class.

9.10 Default Memberwise Assignment
purpose: to copy a class to another one



How C++ processes it?
* first, C++creates a new object
* uses a copy constructor:

    and return the copy to the new object
 
*notes: it's a pass-by-value method:
    great part: security - the called function have no access to modifying data members
    bad part: worsening speed - it copies entire object and that takes time

entry.title: char vs unsigned char
entry.content:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4337217/difference-between-signed-unsigned-char


In C language, there is no 'char' type. char is of integer type and is the smallest integer type. Therefore, like any other integers, char can be signed or unsigned.


Reference:

There's no dedicated "character type" in C language. char is an integer type, same (in that regard) as int, short and other integer types. char just happens to be the smallest integer type. So, just like any other integer type, it can be signed or unsigned.
It is true that (as the name suggests) char is mostly intended to be used to represent characters. But characters in C are represented by their integer "codes", so there's nothing unusual in the fact that an integer type char is used to serve that purpose.
The only general difference between char and other integer types is that plain char is generally not synonymous with signed char, while with other integer types the signed modifier is optional/implied.

entry.title: Why Was 5 x 3 = 5 + 5 + 5 Marked Wrong
entry.content:
(source from https://medium.com/i-math/why-5-x-3-5-5-5-was-marked-wrong-b34607a5b74c#.5zhyjj95l)




5 x 3 -> 5 times 3
it means that there are 5 copies of 3, so it's 3+3+3+3+3


Example 1:
3 bundles of 5 bananas is different from 5 bundles of 3 bananas although they total to the same number of bananas. Their structures are different.


Example 2:
in JavaScript if we test for equality with the == operator:
  • “4” == 4 returns True
because the compiler understands both are referring to the number 4. But if we test for identity using the === operator:
  • “4” === 4 returns False

because they mean different things. The first is a string whereas the second is a number, therefore they are not the same. This is just one example of how equality isn’t always straightforward.

entry.title: 函數間變數PASS – 一般變數、參照、指數
entry.content:
一般
Increment int x = main x; (只拿值)
參照
Increment int x = main x; (將Increment int x名稱 對到跟 main x名稱相同的記憶體位置上)
指數
Increment int *x = main &x; (只拿記憶體位置)


一般
Int main()
{
        Int x = 10;
        Increment(x);
}

Int increment(int x)
{
        x += 1;
}
X -> 10

參照
Int main()
{
        Int x;
        Increment(x);
}

Int increment(int &x)
{
        x += 1;
}
X -> 11

指標
Int main()
{
        Int x;
        Increment(&x);
}

Int increment(int *x)
{
        *x += 1;
}
X -> 11

細部比較：

A. 探討回傳值

1. OK
return: a local variable

2. OK

----以下return非local variable----


暫時先整理成以下Code
myCode:

簡單總結：
不論是回傳reference or pointer
重點在於兩者的目標都是去跟資料的原始memory address要資料，
reference直接要內容，pointer要那個內容的memory address，
其實沒什麼差別，只要拿return時syntax不同，之後取值syntax不同，
但目的觀念一樣。

另外，真正的重點在於資料的memory allocation是否為local or not local，
只要知道這點，就能知道該不該將回傳類型設為reference or pointer

entry.title: C語言-指標
entry.content:
(source from https://knightzone.info:10001/)


使用指標之要點
n宣告：先幫指標取個名字
n取址：用來儲存目標記憶體位置
n取值：透過該位置間接存取該位置中資料的值


單一變數與指標
n宣告：先幫指標取個名字
ex. int *p;  (資料型態 指標名稱)
n取址：用來儲存目標記憶體位置
ex. p = &x; 
n取值：透過該位置間接存取該位置中資料的值
ex. *p (取得現在記憶的記憶體位置中的值)


陣列與指標 (兩者一模一樣)
*notice: 因為陣列名稱本來就是指記憶體位置，所以就當陣列用就好啦

    不同處:
    指標: 自己的記憶體位址 + 儲存另一變數的記憶體位址
    陣列: 只有自己的記憶體位址


動態記憶體配置

一維
    int student;
    scanf("%d", &student);
    int *score;

    score = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*student);

二維
    int **p;
    p = (int **)malloc(sizeof(int *)*NoClass);
    for (int i = 0; i < NoClass; i++) {
        p[i] = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*NoStudent);

    }

entry.title: Ch01 Computer Abstractions and Technology
entry.content:
1.1 Introduction

PostPC Era

PMD
personal mobile deviceex. smart phone , tablet computer

Cloud Computing
relies upon giant datacenters, WSCs
    WSCs
    Warehouse Scale Computers

Software as a Service(Saas)
delivers software and data as a service over the Internet without installing it locally
ex. social networking, web search

As a result, developers today may have a portion of their application run on Cloud and a portion run on PMD.

The performance of a program depends on the following factors:

Hardware or software component
How the component affects performance
Algorithm
Determines both the number of source-level statements and the number of I/O operations executed
Programming language, compiler, and architecture
Determines the number of computer instructions for each source-level statement
Processor and memory system
Determines how fast instructions can be executed
I/O system (hardware and operating system)
Determines how fast I/O operations may be executed


1.2 Eight Great Ideas in Computer Architecture


Design for Moore's Law
definition: integrated circuit resources double every 8-24 months
Adoption: computer architects must anticipate where the technology will be when the design finishes rather than design for where it starts

Use Abstraction to Simplify Design
Why do we need it? to increase productivity while resources grew by Moore's Las
Adoption: lower-level details are hidden to offer a simpler model at higher levels

Make the Common Case Fast
Prerequisite: you know what the common case is through experimenttion and measurement

Performance via Parallelism

Performance via Pipelining
Why do we need it? process normally executes the first instruction it gets, waiting for the next fetched instruction and then execute the next instruction. Process becomes idle while it's waiting for next instruction to be fetched.
How it works: the computer architecture allows the next instructions to be fetched while the processor is performing arithmetic operations, holding them in a buffer close to the processor until each instruction operation can be performed.  (reference)

Performance via Prediction

Hierarchy of Memories
Why do we need it? memory size and cost
How  it works: the fastest, smallest, and most expensive memory put at the top of the hierarchy and the slowest, largest, and cheapest memory put at the bottom of the hierarchy. 

Dependability via Redundancy 



1.3 Below Your Program



system software
ex. operating system, compilers, loaders, assemblers
    operating system
    * handling basic input and output operations
    * Allocating storage and memory
    * Providing for protected resource sharing of the computer among multiple applications using it
       simultaneously
    compiler
    translates high-level language statements into assembly language statements


instruction
collections of bits/binary digit that computer understands and obeys

machine language
binary representation of machine instructions

assembler
translates a symbolic version of instructions into the binary version
assembly language
symbolic representation of machine language

compiler
translates high-level languages statements into assembly language statements




1.4 Under the Covers



Five components of a computer:

input, output, memory, datapath, control
*tip: (processor = datapath + control)
    Input: writes data to memory
    Output: reads data from memory
    processor: gets instructions and data from memory
       control: sends the signals that determine the operations of the datapath, memory, input and output.

I/O devices

graphic display (most common I/O device)
    used liquid crystal displays (LCDs) that controls the transmission of light.
         most LCD uses active matrix that has a tiny transistor switch at each pixel to precisely control
         current and make sharper images
pixels (a matrix of picture elements) (a matrix of bits, called bit map)
    8 bits per color, 24 bits per pixel
frame buffer / raster refresh buffer
    stores the bit map
Raster scan CRT display
    display the bit map



Touchscreen
    uses capacitive sensing (電容式感應)


Memory
DRAM
    dynamic random access memory
    main memory
    volatile memory
SRAM
    purpose: acts as a buffer for the DRAM
    static random access memory
    ex. cache memory in the cpu  
    volatile memory
disk (magnetic disk)
    secondary memory
    nonvolatile memory
flash memory
    nonvolatile memory
    cheaper than DRAM; more expensive than disk
    slower than DRAM; faster than disk
    power efficient
    *notice: wear out after 100,000 to 1,000,000 writes
   


SRAM
DRAM
Flash
Disk
Volatile/nonV
Volatile
Volatile
Non-Volatile
Non-Volatile
Cost
OOOO
OOO
OO
O
Access time
< 10 
nanoseconds
50 to 150 nanoseconds
5 – 50 microseconds
9 to 15 
milliseconds

*note: nanoseconds – billionths of a second
*note: microseconds – millionth of a second

*note: milliseconds – thousandth of a second


Instruction set architecture
(or simply architecture)
an abstract interface between the hardware and the lowest-level software.
    * it enables programmers to write machine codes without worrying about the details of doing IO,
       allocating memory, and other low-level system functions
    * enables many implementations of varying cost and performance to run identical software
        * implementations: hardware that obeys the architecture abstraction

application binary interface(ABI)
the combination of the basic instruction set and the operating system interface provided for programmers




1.6 Performance

response time
the total time required for the computer to complete a task

throughout/bandwidth
the total amount of work done in a given time

*note: 兩者呈反比關係




Measuring Performance

How it works: when a process work on several programs simultaneously. It tries to optimize throughput rather than attempt to minimize the elapsed time for one program.

elapsed time:
time spent waiting for resources (I/O or running other programs.)
    *note: the response time experienced by the user will be the elapsed time of the program
CPU execution time
time spent for actually running a program  
    user CPU time (a program)
    system CPU time (OS)


Clock / Clock period

clock cycle/ clock periods (指趟數)
the length of clock cycle = T (每一次beat花多幾秒)
the frequency of clock cycle -> clock rates = 1 / T  (每秒可以動次棟次幾次)

What's a Clock Used For?
We use a clock to synchronize the events of a CPU. Devices in a CPU can be categorized as sequential circuits or combinational circuits. Sequential logic devices use a clock. Basically, sequential logic devices can only change outputs once a period, usually during a positive or a negative edge. We'll assume that a sequential device can only change outputs on positive clock edges.

To give you an analogy, imagine a music conductor tapping a beat with a baton (a stick) at regular intervals. Suppose you are playing a piano, and you're told to play a new note each time he taps his baton. Thus, how fast the conductor taps the baton controls how often you play notes.

Similarly, the rate at which the positive clock edge appears controls how fast a sequential logic device can change outputs.

It turns out that by using a clock, we can design a CPU more easily than if we don't use a clock. This is primary reason to use a clock. (source from here)
How to measure CPU execution time?




Instruction Performance
... -> compiler -> instruction -> computer execute those instructions

*note: CPI
    clock cycles per instruction
    Average number of clock cycles per instruction for a program

The Classic CPU Performance Equation

作者：周秉誼 / 臺灣大學計算機及資訊網路中心作業管理組碩士後研究人員
GNU開發工具是Linux作業系統、嵌入式系統、與自由及開放原始碼軟體社群中，最常見、使用得最廣泛的程式開發工具，可以協助程式設計人員完成從原始程式碼到二進制機械碼時各項煩瑣的工作，能夠大幅提昇程式的執行效率。不但支援多種程式語言、多種作業系統，也可以產生多種不同處理器的執行檔，是跨平台程式開發和移植的最佳工具。

entry.title: Ch06 Functions and an Introduction to Recursion - 2
entry.content:
6.11 Function Call Stack and Activation Records

Stack
a type of data structure
    LIFO data structure (Last-In-First-Out)
    pushed to the top; popped from the top

function call stack
    activation record/stack frame
    Each time when a function is called by another function, an entry is pushed onto the stack.
    And the entry is called activation record or stack frame
        * the return address of the calling function
        * the automatic variables of the called function

stack overflow
when too many function calls occur at the same time      

Example:


1st: Operating system calls the main function in the program



2nd: the main function calls the square function in main function

3rd: the square function return the value back to main function




4th: the main function return the value back to operating system




6.12 Function with Empty Parameter Lists

void function1();
void function2(void);


6.13 Inline Function

purpose: to reduce function call overhead



How does it work?
inline keywords 'advises" the compiler to insert a copy of the function's body code in place to avoid a function call. (rather than there being a single copy of the function to which control is passed each time the function code is called)
* notice: the complete definition of the function needs to be put before main function, so that compiler knows what to copy



6.14 References and Reference Parameters


Two ways to pass arguments to functions:
1. pass-by-value:
    a copy of the argument's value is made and passed to the called function
    *notice: disadvantage of this method: copying large data will take too much time
2. pass-by-reference:
    purpose: to let called function have access to caller's data directly and to modify that data
    what's reference?  it's simple an alias for a variable. (implicit address of the variable)
   

   
(file)

Input-By-Value
int squareByValue( int );
squareByValue( x );
int squareByValue( int number) { return number * nunber}

Input-By-Reference (no return)
void squareByReference(int &numberRef);
squareByReference( z );
    cout << z;
void squareByReference(int &numberRef){ numberRef *= number Ref}

Input-By-Reference (return reference)
int& squareByReference(int &numberRef);
cout << squareByReference( z );;
int& squareByReference(int &numberRef)
    { numberRef *= numberRef;  //initialize the reference with a lvalue 
       return numberRef;
     }

    *notice: do not return a reference to a automatic variable in the called function, cuz the variable
    will be discarded once the called function terminates.
    ex.  


*note: We can't differentiate pass-by-value function and pass-by-reference function from the function call, because the input arguments are the same (ex. x , y , o)

*Tip: constant int &numberRef ( function parameter)
    1. benefit 1: simulate the appearance and security of pass-by-value
    2. benefit 2: avoid the overhead of copying large objects (詳見補充1)

*note: disadvantage of using reference:
If we use pointer to pass variable to function, we will be cautious that the values of the variable might be modified in that function. However, if we use reference to pass those variables to the function, we won't know that.

補充1: Reference vs Variable
purpose: to avoid the overhead of copying large objects

disadvantage of using variable: 
    If arguments are passed by value, it will copy the entire data every time the function is called.
    Therefore, it takes lots of time to process.


6.15 Default Arguments



Rules:
* default arguments must  be the rightmost arguments in a function's parameter list
* be specified when the function name first appears (usually function prototype)
* default values can be any expression(global variables, constants, function calls)


6.16 Unary Scope Resolution Operator

:: scpoe resolution operator


Purpose: when a local variable has the same name as a global variable, use :: to access global variable
*tip: always use :: to access global variable; make program easier to read


6.17 Function Overloading

Purpose: make functions that perform similar tasks have the same function name; thus, make the program easier to understand. (ex. square(int); sqaure(double))
Definition:
function overloading means several functions have the same name but different parameter list.
                   prototype = signature + return type
                   signature = function name +parameter list
                   parameter list = number ,name, type and order of arguments



How the compiler differentiate overloaded functions?
compiler encodes each function identifier with the number and types of its parameters(mangling/ name decoration) to enable type-safe linkage
    type-safe linkage
    ensures the proper overloaded function is called the types of arguments match the parameter list

補充：(fig6.25 GNU C++ - mangled function name format)


*notice: overloading allows cin/cout to:
    ● tell what type of input/out is and use corresponding function with the same function name.
    ● allow users to input a regular variable because cin/cou uses reference to take for its parameter parameters




6.18 Function Templates

(one further step  as to overloaded functions)
meaning: defining a single function template essentially defines a whole family of overloaded functions



(file)


6.19 Recursion
6.19-2 Example Using Recursion: Factorial function




6.20 Example Using Recursion: Fibonacci Series


*notice:
the order of evaluation of operands are not assumed from left to right in C++
therefore, fib(n-2) may be evaluated before fib(n-1)
    *exception: &&, ||, ,     ?:   
         operands of these operators are assumed to be left to right in C++

*notice:  exponential complexity
In this case, to calculate nth Fibonacci number requires calling function 2的n次方次, causing overhead of function calls




6.21 Recursion vs. Iteration

Using Iteration



Using Recursion


*note: Any problem that can be solved recursively can also be solved iteratively.
*note: avoid using recursion in performance situations. Recursive calls take time and consume additional memory

entry.title: Ch06 Functions and an Introduction to Recursion
entry.content:
6.2 Program Components in C++

The merits of modularizing a program with functions:
* divide-and-conquer approach
* software reuse
* avoid repeating codes
* easier to debug and maintain

6.3 Math Library Functions

global function
functions that are not members of a class
it can be called directly simply with the function name

<cmath> header

pow(x, y)
x的y次方

(file)

sqrt(900.0)



ceil( 9.2 )
floor( 9.2)



6.4 Function Definitions with Multiple Parameters






the order of evaluation of a function's arguments
(還不是很懂)
The order of evaluation of a function's arguments, however, is not specified by the C++ standard. Thus, different compilers can evaluate function arguments in different orders.

Sometime when a function's arguments are expressions, such as those with calls to other functions, the order in which the compiler evaluates the arguments could affect the values of one or more of the arguments..

    How to avoid this problem:
        evaluate the arguments before the function call, assign the result of each expression to a local
        variable, then pass those variables as arguments to the function



Rules of function parameters
(if use three files to accomplish this task)
main.cpp:
    GradeBook.myGradeBook("CS101 Programming language");
    myGradeBook.inputGrades();   function call
GradeBook.cpp:
    GradeBook::maximum( int x, int y, int z) {}   function header
GradeBook.h:
    function prototype: int maximum( int, int, int);   function prototype

    Rules:
    function prototype, function header, function call must conform with each other on the followings:
    * number of arguments and parameters
    * type of arguments of parameters
    * order of arguments of parameters
    * return type


Three ways to end a function call
1. (none)
2. return;
3. return expression;


6.5 Function Prototypes and Argument Coercion

function prototype
tells compiler the following information:
* name of a function
* number of parameters the function takes
* type of parameters
* order of parameters taken
* return type

function signature
signature = prototype - return type
    rule: function in the same scope must have unique signatures

argument coercion
function prototypes will force arguments to the appropriate types specified by the parameter declarations


※補充:
Argument Promotion Rules
indicates the implicit conversions that the compiler can perform between fundamental types
    Applied situations:
    1. expressions containing values of two or more data types   (mixed-type expressions)
        rule: promoted to the "highest" type in the expression
    2. the type of a function argument does not match the parameter type specified in the function prototype(or definition)
        rule: promote arguments to the type of parameters
  *notice: converting a type to a higher type is OK; however,  converting a type to a lower one will cause problems
    ex. squre(4.5) returns 16, not 20.25  -> because compiler convert the floating  no. 4.5 to int type

6.6 C++ Standard Library Headers



6.7 Case Study: Random Number Generation

<cstdlib>  rand()
rand generates unsigned number from 0 to RAND_MAX

Purpose: simulate 20 rolls of a six-sided die and display the value of each roll (5 numbers in a row)(set width 10)




(file)

* notice: the result is the same sequence, because rand() function is actually producing pseudorandom numbers


<cstdlib>  srand(seed)
purpose: to actually randomizing the result
process: srand takes an unsigned integer argument and seeds the rand function to produce a different sequence of random numbers for each execution. (this unpredictable numbers are called nondeterministic random numbers)




(file)
(fileV2): #include <ctime>; srand( time(0) )

*notice: the result is different if the seed entered varies from one another




6.8 Case Study: Game of Chance; Introducing enum




(file)

enum Status {CONTINUE, WON, LOST};
<iostream> enum
an enumeration is a set of integer constants represented by identifiers, starting from 0

    Status gameProcess;
    enum Status: define a new user-defined type
        {CONTINUE, WON, LOST}:  three values are created for this new type Status
                                                            CONTINUE-> 0; WON-> 1; LOST->2
    Status gameProcess: Variable gameProcess is declared to be of new type Status




6.9 Storage Classes


Attributes of identifier:
name, type, size, value
storage class, scope, linkage

storage class
determines the period during which a identifier exist in memory
scope
determines where a identifier is accessible
linkage
determines whether it's known only in the source file where it's declared or
across multiple files that are compiled

Storage Class (period)
storage class specifiers
auto, register, static, extern ,mutable
    automatic storage class:
    automatic variable only exists in the neares enclosing pair of curly braces 
        auto: ex. auto double x;
            it's default. It's local variable
        register: ex. register int counter = 1;
            puts frequently-used variable to register
            it can be used only with local variables and function parameters
 
    static storage class:
    static variables exist throughout the whole duration of a program
        extern: global variables
        static:  static local variables (local variables declared with static storage-class specifier)

Scope 
Four scopes for an identifier
global namespace scope: a identifier declared outside any function or class
function scope: Labels (used with goto statement) only accessible within the function body
local scope: { local scope}
function-prototype scope: those used in the parameter list of a function prototype

tips: avoid using identifier names that have been used in outer scopes

5.8 Logical Operators

Tip: how to reduce a program's executing time
&&: put the most like false expression to the leftmost condition
||: put the most like true expression to the leftmost condition

Tip: how to prevent misuse = as == operator
instead of writing if (x == 0), we can write as if (0 == x).
By doing so, we can prevent we type = accidentally. The compiler will view it as a compilation error.


5.10 Structured Programming Summary

Rules for forming a structured programs
1. Begin with the "simplest activity diagram"
2. Any action state can be replaced by two action states in sequence
3. Any action state can be replaced by any control statement (sequence, if, if..else, switch, while, do... while, for)
4. Rules 2 and 3 can be applied as often as you like and in any order

Exercises 3.12 (p. 131)

The top:
Class:

Main():
create two Account objects and initialize their balance //use construct function
if the input amount for initial balance is higher than 0 or equal to 0
    add the balance
else
    set balance to 0
    print error message "invalid input for balance"

add amount to balances of two objects  // use credit function
print the current amount of two objects

withdraw amount from balance of two objects // use debit function
if the remaining amount is fewer than the withdraw amount
    print message "Debit amount exceeded account balance."  
else
    reduce the amount of balance
print the current amount of two objects  // use getBalance function


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
developing the Pseudocode Algorithm with Top-Down, Stepwise Refinement: The Top and First Refinement (p.152)

The top:
Determine the class average for the quiz for an arbitrary number of students

The first refinement:
Initialize variables
Input, sum and count the quiz grades
Calculate and print the total of all student grades and the class average

The second refinement:
Initialize total to zero
Initialize counter to zero

Prompt the user to enter the first grade
Input the first grade (possibly the sentinel)

While the user has not yet entered the sentinel
    Add this grade into the running total
    Add one to the grade counter
    Prompt the user to enter the first grade
    Input the next grade (possibly the sentinel)

If the counter is not equal to zero
    Set the average to the total divided by the counter
    Print the total of the grades for all students in the class
    Print the average of the class
else
    Print "no grades were entered"

Six ….

Mummy, What’s virgin mean?

What does virgin mean?

Girls and boys, I mean, grandmas

But They’re made to fit together in a very clever way

Like gikerso

Like gikso grandpa does?

When a mummy and daddy love each other. A lot.

Sort of.

entry.title: Ch03 Introduction to Classes, Objects and Strings
entry.content:
3.2 Defining a Class with a Member function


(file)

class GradeBook {};
define a class
*note: It's a statement, too, so it ends with a semicolon.
*note: each class you create becomes a new type that can be used to create objects.
  (that's why C++ is known as extensible language)

public:
access specifier
member functions inside public access specifier are available by other functions in the program(ex. main()) and available to member functions of other classes

void displayMessage() {}
define a memeber function
void this member function will no return any value
() this memeber function need no argumetns
*note: no semicolon is needed when inside an access specifier

GradeBook myGradeBook;
* create an object that belongs to myGradeBook class
* (also means)define myGradeBook as a GradeBook type (a new user-defined type)

myGradeBook.displayMessage
(object name).(member function name)
call the member function of myGradeBook object

※補充
UML Class Diagram for Class GradeBook: (read more)





3.3 Defining a Member Function with a Parameter


(file)

#include <string>
a header 
a C++ standard Library string class
ex. string courseName
ex. string nameOfCourse
the name string, like cout, belongs to namespace std
the variable defined as type string is actually an object of the C++ standard Library class string

getline(cin, nameOfCourse);
* note: <string> header must be included to use function getline, which belongs to namespace std
cin >> nameOfCourse; vs getline(cin, nameOfCourse);:
The left one: reads characters until the first white-space character is reached
The right one: reads characters(from the standard input stream object cin), until the first new line is reached


myGradeBook.displayMessage( nameOfCourse); (line 29)
( nameOfCourse) -> (arguments)
void displayMessage(string courseName) {}   (line 12)
(string courseName) -> (parameters)

※補充





3.3 Data Members, set Functions and get Functions



(file)

private:
    string courseName;  (line 23)
Why do we need it: (goto -> 3.8 Validating Data with set Functions)
    
data members inside private access specifier can only be accessed 'directly' by member function of the current object;
however, they are 'indirectly' accessible by clients of an object (ex. function main(){ myGradeBook.setCoursename }. Here main(){} is a client of an object)



*note: 不同點在於可能client of an  object看到的資料形式是"HH:MM:SS"，但在object裡面private string time的實際資料形式是seconds。而通常class會提供client of an object set & get function to interact with the data member inside the private access specifier.

string getCourseName() { return nameCourse;}
void setCourseName(string name) {nameCourse = name;}
Set and Get Function
Set functions -> also called mutator
Get functions -> also called accessors
* purpose : to let clients of objects to use set and get function to interact with the data members of certain objects
* great practice: using set and get function by other member functions within the same class:
    ex. void displayMessage() { cout << "the current course is:" << getCoursename() <<endl; }
    -> When a private member's name is changed, we only have to adjust getCoursename() and
         void displayMessage() function would change automatically;
        therefore, make the class easier to maintain, modify and adjust (make it a more robust class)

client of an object
any statement that calls the object's member functions from outside the object - calls the class's public member functions to request the class's services for particular objects of the class.

※補充




3.5 Initializing Objects with Constructors






(file)

Why do we need a constructor? 
-> what if we want to provide a course name argument to a member data when you create a GradeBook object?

Constructor
a special member function 
definition rules:
* must use the same name as the class's
* can not return value (so even no void is needed)
* C++ requires a constructor call for each object that's created.

default constructor
any constructor that takes no arguments is called a default constructor.
(下述 1-(2) & 2.)
   1. constructor defined explicitly:
        (1) require parameter -> act as expect
             if the data member variable is just a data member:
             assign the value to the data member
        (2) no parameter required -> (不是很懂)
             when the data member variable is also an object of a sub class:
             it will call the default constructor for each data member that's an object of another class and
             will perform additional initialization specified by you

   2. constructor undefined:
       The compiler implicitly creates a default constructor in the class.
       * will not initialize the class's data members. (An uninitialized variable typically contains a "garbage" value)
       * call the default constructor for each data member that's an object of another class.
   ex. class GradeBook {  /* no contrustor defined */.... string courseName ....  };
   the string data member courseName was initialized to the empty string - the default constructor for class string sets the string's value to the empty string.

default constructor + function overloading(函式重載)





default constructor + default arguments





GradeBook gradeBook1( "CS101 Intro ......");
constructor call occurs implicitly when a object is created. ##
*note: we can't say GradeBook is a constructor call because GradeBook is a new type(class) that we define before. GradeBook is more like int, char; it's a way to define variable type.

※補充


<<constructor>> + GradeBook( name : String)



3.7 Placing a Class in a Separate File for Reusability






Why do we need a header file (GradeBook.h)?
to make the header reusable.

Size
Compiler creates only one copy of the class's member functions and shares that copy among all the class's objects.

Each object has its own copy of the class's data member; compiler knows how much memory is required to create an object of a class by the size of data member.

#include "GradeBook.h" (Fig3.10 line 4)
instructs C++ preprocessor to replace the directive with a copy of the contents of GradeBook.h

how compiler locates headers?
#include <*****>: look for the directory of the C++ standard library
#include "****.h": first, the same directory as the source-code file
                               second, the directory of the C++ standard library



3.7 Separating Interface from Implementation



Three files:
main.cpp
GradeBook.cpp
GradeBook.h

What's the purpose of separating files into three components?
to separate interface from implementation.
to decide what operation(member function) are permitted to a class's clients

main.cpp:
     #include <iostream>
     #include "GradeBook.h"
     using namespace std;

GradeBook.cpp       (the source-code for member functions' definition)
    #include <iostream>
    #include "GradeBook.h"
    using namespace std;

GradeBook.h
    #include <iostream>
    #include <string>
    using namespace std;


GradeBook.h -> function prototypes 
describe the class's public interface without revealing the class's member-function implementations
● three components: function name, output type, parameter type&order
○ the parameter identifier are not included because it'll ignored by compiler
○ must end with semicolon ;



GradeBook.cpp 
○ don't declare the class again
○ no need for public access specifier
    GradeBook::GradeBook(string name)
    :: binary scope resolution operator
    indicates that the following is the member function of the class GradeBook
    *Q: can I view namespaces as classes' names?
         like GradeBook:: means that same as std::



main.cpp



3.8 Validating Data with set Functions



The purpose: validate input via set function

(string name)
name.length()
shows how many characters this string has
name.substr(0,25)
extract the first 25 characters out of the string name

consistent state
a state in which the objects data member courseName contains a valid value.(even if the parameter name is too long) Thus, we extract the first 25 characters as the value of data member courseName


進階: destructor

A destructor is a special member function that is called when the lifetime of an object ends. The purpose of the destructor is to free the resources that the object may have acquired during its lifetime.

運用一: class - destructor + dynamic memory allocation

function: to use +-*/ as a function call

(Codes)

main.cpp

進階: Class - Encapsulation(繼承)

基本定義語法：


Child class can't access private data member in the Parental Class?
-> protected


How to call specific constructor of parental class in child class? 
default: a constructor call in child class will always call the default constructor in parental class (which means no arguments are input to the constructor)




*notice: if no child constructor is defined, the child class will call the default constructor of its parental class.

Exercise

What's the difference between a local variable and a data member?
a local variable is declared in a function, and it's only accessible from its declaration to the closing brace of the block in which it's declared.
data member is declared in a class, but not in the body of any of the class's member function. Every object of a class has its own copy of data members. Data members are accessible to all member functions of the class. Clients of a class's object can only access these data members through member functions, usually set or get functions.

What's the difference between a parameter and an argument? 
parameter is the additional information needed by a function to execute.
arguments are the information supplied in a function call.
When a function is called, the argument value is passed into the function parameter so that the function can perform its task.

entry.title: UML - Standard Diagrams
entry.content:
(Source from http://www.tutorialspoint.com/uml/uml_standard_diagrams.htm)
There are two broad categories of diagrams and then are again divided into sub-categories:
  • Structural Diagrams
  • Behavioral Diagrams

Structural Diagrams:

The structural diagrams represent the static aspect of the system. These static aspects represent those parts of a diagram which forms the main structure and therefore stable.
These static parts are represents by classes, interfaces, objects, components and nodes. The four structural diagrams are:
  • Class diagram
  • Object diagram
  • Component diagram
  • Deployment diagram

Class Diagram:

Class diagrams are the most common diagrams used in UML. Class diagram consists of classes, interfaces, associations and collaboration.
Class diagrams basically represent the object oriented view of a system which is static in nature.
Active class is used in a class diagram to represent the concurrency of the system.
Class diagram represents the object orientation of a system. So it is generally used for development purpose. This is the most widely used diagram at the time of system construction.

This is a preprocessor directive. This line will be processed by the preprocessor before the program is compiled.
#include <iostream> notifies the preprocessor to include in the program the contents of the input/output stream header <iostream>.

int main () {...}
* one function in every program must be named main
* C++ programs begin executing at function main, even if main is not the first function in the program.

std::cout << "..."
cout standard output stream object 
<< stream extraction operator 
std::
purpose: to differentiate different names withing program
The std::(姓氏) before cout is the namespace we need when we want to bring certain names(ex. cout) into the program for use. In this case, we've brought the name, cout, into the program by the preprocessor directive #include <iostream>. The notation std::cout specifies that we are using a name, in this case cout, that belongs to "namespace" std.
    std:: -> namesapce
    cout -> name



Tip: C++ statement vs preprocessor directives:
statements end with ;
preprocessor directives do not end with ;

stream manipulator
It outputs a newline, then "flushes the output buffer."

    On some systems, where outputs accumulate in the machine until there are enough to "make it worthwhile" to display them on the screen, std::endl forces any accumulated outputs to be displayed at that moment.

entry.title: Ch01 Introduction to Computers and C++
entry.content:
Computer Organization

Data Hierarchy

* bits: 0 , 1   ex. 0 or 1
* bytes(Character):     ex. J
   (1 Byte = 8 bits;)
   0-9, a-z A-Z, symbols: #(?+-
   ASCII list
* (fields):  composed of characters   ex. Judy
* (records): composed of fields   ex Judy   0921665326   Taichung county
* files:
   can be viewed simply as a sequence of bytes

Logical Units

* input unit
* output unit
* memory unit


* ALU (Arithmetic and logic unit):
   the "manufacturing" section
   nowadays, it's usually implemented in CPU
* CPU (Central processing unit):
   the "administrative" section
* Secondary storage unit: (一般硬碟)


Levels of computing languages:

※note: Interpreter programs were developed to execute high-level language programs (like Perl.exe, Python.exe)


Objects


Steps of executing a C++ application:

1. Editing to disk:
    C++ source code filenamse are often .cpp, .cxx, .cc, .C
    via Editor like vi for Linux, Microsoft Visual C++
    via IDEs like Dev C++
2. Preprocessing to disk:
    preprocessor obeys commands called preprocessor directives, ex #include <iostream>
3. Compling to disk:  
4. Linking to disk:
    link the object code, which contains "holes" due to missing parts, to other codes to reference
    certain functions and data.
5. Loading to memory:
6. Execution


*note: term - IDEs (integrated development environments)
  ex. Dev C++, Visual Studio


Linux - how to use .cpp file

wget http://media.pearsoncmg.com/ph/esm/deitel/cpp_htp_8/code_examples/ch01.zip
unzip ch01.zip 
cd /root/桌面/C++examples/ch01/GuessNumber/GNU_Linux
g++ GuessNumber.cpp  -o GuessNumber  (make the cpp file an executable program)
ll     -> to make sure GuessNumber is executable
./GuessNumber 

Self-Review Exercises

C++ enhances the C language and provides capabilities for OOP. (Oriented-Object Program)

In a C++ system, a Java program executes before the compiler's translation phase begins.
Fortran language is for scientific and engineering purpose.
COBOL is for commercial industry which requires manipulation of enormous amount of data

The ALU(Arithmetic and logic unit) is the "manufacturing" section of the computer. It's job is to calculate

C++ programmers create their own user-defines types called classes.

the state of being extremely dirty and unpleasant, especially as a result of poverty or neglect.

a lifestyle consists of the following characteristics: 
1)no drugs

4) Yes, we do have fun

entry.title: English Club - what if you could redo a decision in the past?
entry.content:
When we grow up, we've been making plenty decisions every day, small ones like buying drinks or big ones like getting your first job. However, we found that not every choices we made panned out as we expected. From time to time, we wonder what if I didn't ... would my life become totally different?
If one day, a little elf shows up beside your bed at night. Then, she tells that you've worked so hard for your life and your family. Therefore, she wants to give you a chance to remake a decision you made in the past.
At that night, what would you tell the elf?and why?



※ Other topics to use:
Topic two - what's the biggest decision you make in your life?
Topic three: do you have any small weird habits you feel awkward to share about? you always talk to your puppet before you fall asleep? you always eat cereals with coca cola? or you never wear purple clothes because you hate eggplant so much?

entry.title: 找出質數
entry.content:
第一種方法 - 用除的餘數來判斷質數

#include <stdio.h>

int main () {
bool primeNo = true;

for (int i = 2; i <= 1000; i++) {
primeNo = true; // assume it's primeNo at first
for (int j = 2; j < i; j++) {
if (i % j == 0) primeNo = false; // if not once, make it false
}
if (primeNo == true) printf("%d\n",i);

}
return 0;
}





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


第二種方法  用倍數來刪掉和數
#include <stdio.h>

int main () {

int primeNo[100] = {0}; //primeNo[0] -> primeNo[99]
int sum = 0;
// 找倍數
for (int i = 2; i <= 100; i++ ) {
sum = i;
while (sum <= 100)
{
sum += i;
if (sum <= 100) primeNo[sum]=1; // tag it as removed element
// in the end, sum > 100
}
}
for (int i = 2; i <= 100; i++) {
if (primeNo[i] == 0) printf("%d\n", i);
}

return 0;
}

entry.title: scanf() 標準輸入函式
entry.content:
(source from http://squall.cs.ntou.edu.tw/cprog/Materials/ScanfIntroduction.html )

scanf


標準輸出入函式庫 (stdio.lib, stdio.h)

scanf() 函式是標準輸出入函式庫中的一員， 在 C 程式中常常藉由此函式從鍵盤上讀入字元資料， 並轉換格式為程式內其它型態的資料， 此稱為 "格式化 (formatted) 的輸入 (input) 函式"
注意：以後會學到 fread, fwrite 之類非格式化的輸出入函式

如何使用 stdio 函式庫內的函式

程式中要使用 scanf() 函式的話， 在使用之前一定要有 #include <stdio.h> 這一列敘述將此 stdio.h 檔案一併含入編譯， 此檔案內有 scanf() 函式及其參數型態的宣告， 宣告一次以後就可以在程式內任何地方使用了。

基本用法：


  1. 由鍵盤讀入一個十進位數字至一整數中， 並讀入一個十進位實數至一浮點變數中，
      int x, y;
      float z;
      scanf("%d",&x);
      scanf("%d%f",&y, &z);
    請注意：scanf()會將十進位數字字串根據 % 後的指定格式 (d 或是 f) 轉換為二進位的表示方法， & 為取址符號， 請務必使用於目的地變數 (x, y, z) 之前， 原因會在討論指標時解釋。
  2. 由鍵盤讀入一字元至一字元變數中
      char c;
      scanf("%c",&c);
    請注意：如果 % 之前加一空格的話代表跳過所有空格 (TAB、 space、 及 Enter) 字元，例如：

      char c;
      scanf("　%c",&c);

  3. 在 TURBO C 中讀取 long 型態整數必須用 %ld， 讀取 double 型態浮點數必須用 %lf， 否則執行時讀入的數字會錯誤。
      long lNumber;
      scanf("%ld", &lNumber);
      -----------------------
      double dValue;
      scanf("%lf", &dValue);
    注意：在 32 位元的編譯器 (例如：Visual C/C++) 中 就無所謂了，只要用 %d 及 %f 就可以了。

entry.title: 程式設計 - 约瑟夫问题: 唯一存活的犯人
entry.content:
(備註：圖文不符,好看用)

約瑟夫問題：
有ｎ個犯人，按順時針方向圍成一圈（編號從１到ｎ），從第１號開始報數，一直數到ｍ，數到ｍ的犯人會被槍斃，剩下的犯人再接着從1開始報數。就這樣，直到圈內只剩下一位犯人時，這位犯人就能被逃過死刑。編程求輸入ｎ，ｍ後，輸出最後唯一存活犯人的編號。



result:



#!/usr/bin/perl
#v2: basic function
#v3: get rid of unnecessary stuffs
use warnings;
use strict;

print "please enter the total number of criminals in a ring: ";
my $total = <>;
print "please enter the number which the criminal who calls will get shot: ";
my $deadNo = <>; #變量deadNo 
my $deadNoDefault = $deadNo;  #常量deadNo
my $survival = 0 ; # the survival

#print "total number: ", $total," "; #debugging
#print "dead number: ", $deadNo," "; #debugging

my @ring = ();  ## criminals are gathered as a circile
## 給每位criminals編號
for my $i (0..$total-1) {
push @ring, $i;
#print $i, " ";
}
#print @ring," "; #debugging

#calculation
$survival = (kickout($total,$deadNo,\@ring,$deadNoDefault) + 1); ## put array into a sub function by using reference  ## +1 呈現編號結果}
## our result
print "The survival: ", "No. $survival criminal"," "; ## the survival !!
print "No. $survival criminal says: 'I am alive!'"," ";


# to filter out the killed criminal for each turn
sub kickout {  # take four arguments: $total, $deadNo, \@ring, $deadNoDefault
my $total = $_[0]; my $deadNo = $_[1]; my @ring = @{$_[2]}; my $deadNoDefault = $_[3];
my $switch = 0; # to tell if # to tell if $deadNo > $total happens
#print $total, $deadNo, @ring, $deadNoDefault; #debugging
if ($deadNo > $total) { # 這一輪還沒有犯人出局
$deadNo -= $total;  
$switch = 1;
print "deadNo:  $deadNo  total:  $total   switch index: $switch"," "; #debugging
sleep 1; #debugging
kickout($total,$deadNo,\@ring,$deadNoDefault);
}#end if
else { ## $deadNo < $total - 這一輪就有犯人出局
splice @ring, $deadNo-1, 1;
$total -= 1; return $ring[0] if $total == 1;
#print @ring; #debugging
$deadNo = $deadNoDefault; chomp $deadNo; # return the default value of deadNo 
$switch = 0;
print "deadNo:  $deadNo  total:  $total   switch index: $switch ";
sleep 1;
kickout($total,$deadNo,\@ring,$deadNoDefault);

}#end else
}#end sub kickout

entry.title: C語言-何謂void
entry.content:
(source from http://www.study-area.org/coobila/tutorial_409.html)

C語言基本架構介紹.以及基本觀念簡介.
/* My First C program */
#include 

void main(void)
{
int i;
i = 1;
printf("Hi! C!\n");
printf("This is my %dst C program!",i);
}

--------------------------------------------------------
void main(void)
{
........
}
((C語言的主體))
而main()是C語言程式的開頭..程式的內容是存於main()之後的{}中..
所有的C語言程式都是由main開始執行..是說即使將來C程式大到很複雜..
main()可能不是擺在程式的最開頭..但C語言編譯器仍會找到main()來開始執行..
由於C語言是自由格式..所以也可以寫成這樣 void main(void) { }

而void的意思本義是"無"或"沒有"的意思..所以在main之前..
是作為..沒有回傳值的意思..也就是當程式執行時..不會傳回訊息給DOS..
而main()之中的void則是表示不會由作業系統把命令參數傳入main()之中..

所以void main(void)是最簡單的C語言格式..表示main將不能由作業系統接收命令參數..
也不會將訊息傳回作業系統..如果將格式寫為 int main() ..則將會有回傳值給作業系統..

entry.title: Data abstraction
entry.content:
(source from http://www.tutorialspoint.com/cplusplus/cpp_data_abstraction.htm)


Data abstraction refers to, providing only essential information to the outside world and hiding their background details, i.e., to represent the needed information in program without presenting the details.
Data abstraction is a programming (and design) technique that relies on the separation of interface and implementation.

For example, your program can make a call to the sort()function without knowing what algorithm the function actually uses to sort the given values. In fact, the underlying implementation of the sorting functionality could change between releases of the library, and as long as the interface stays the same, your function call will still work.

entry.title: ADT - Abstract Data Type
entry.content:
(轉錄自 http://skycab.pixnet.net/blog/post/25019079 by skycab)
受到 C# 的薰陶，一時間忘了 ADT 另一層的函意。今天在《Fundamentals of Data Structure in C++》中看到一段話：
The specification, which must be contained inside the public portion of the class definition of the ADT, consists of the names of every public member function, the type of its arguments, and the type of its result (This information about a function is known as its function prototype). There should also be a description of the function does, which does not refer to the internal representation or implementation details. This requirement is quite important because it implies that an abstract data type is implementation-independent.
Specifications of ADT: 
* name of function
* type of its argument
* type of its result
* description

一個完整的 ADT ，不僅要符合 Data abstraction 及 Encapsulation；更重要的是，它必須與實作無關。
ADT 著重於形態的抽象概念，而不是如何實踐此概念，因此 ADT 每一個 member function，只需說明此 function 能做什麼、該做什麼，而不必明定此 function 該如何做。
譬如說，一個 bignumber ADT 包含 add 此 member function。設計者只管以註解說明它的功用（對兩個 bignumber object 做相加），至於如何相加，相加後如何維護，皆與設計者無關。這些實作上的細節，是為實踐這些抽象概念的 programmer 才需關注的。
總之，ADT 是一種概念的陳述、一種規格的規範。它提供下一層設計者一些概念、一些介面標準，有助於設計者完成此 Type。但 ADT 絕不必提供任何實作上的資訊，就好像某 ADT 的使用者，絕不必了解它如何被實作出，只管此 ADT 代表什麼概念、提供了哪些功能。

ip dhcp excluded-address 10.0.10.1 去除掉自己的 L3 interface IP
ip dhcp pool VLAN10POOL 替這個dhcp pool取名
network 10.0.10.0 255.255.255.0 要將這個dhcp pool對應到哪個 l3 interface -> int vlan 10，因為為同網段。此也為將發放的IP範圍。
default-router 10.0.10.1  DHCP client將會以此為gateway IP
lease 2  lease 兩天



查詢目前ip 發放狀況


查詢目前發放IP與主機binding狀況
Client-identifier是DHCP serve給此host的一個辨識編號



如何讓特定host拿到特定IP
先清掉原本的cache

設定
ip dhcp pool 重新建另一個pool
host 10.0.10.200 255.255.255.0  要發送的IP
default-router 要給的 gw IP
client-identifier 從剛剛的sh ip dhcp binindg找到的，在此放上去
-> 之後client主機重新再要求IP即可拿到10.0.10.200 /24這個IP

entry.title: VTP
entry.content:
資料來源https://www.ciscolearningsystem.com (此文章僅為個人學習整理筆記)



















Switches of client and server mode  save its VLAN configuration to its vlan.dat file in its flash memory.
Switches of transparent mode save its VLAN configuration to its startup.config file.


設定指令


設定總覽




查看指令
查看模式






















建議設定:
Switch(config)# vtp password xyz123
Switch(config)# vtp mode transparent
Switch(config)# vtp domain DOMAIN_NAME
不要用VTP，避免Switch動態更新到自己或他人的VTP database






注意:
A VTP client can overwrite a VTP server database if the client has a higher revision number.

如果在一network中，有使用VTP。
在每次要更換設備時，都要注意先將revions number削掉：
The VTP revision number is stored in NVRAM and is not reset if you erase switch configuration and reload it. To reset the VTP revision number to zero, you have two options:
1. 更改VTP domain，再改到現在要用的那個 
Change the switch VTP domain to a nonexistent VTP domain and then change the domain back to the original name.
2. 更改VTP mode to transparent，再改回原本的
Change the switch VTP mode to transparent and then back to previous VTP mode.

entry.title: VPN
entry.content:
VPN
VPN模式：

MPLS由ISP提供的加密連線服務
IPSecVPN較適用於企業跨Internet網段對網路的安全連線。
SSLVPN較適合各別員工從Internet遠端存取公司內部資源

VPN功能:

1.認證,授權
2.存取控管
3.傳輸保全
4.資料安全
5.私有虛擬通道




IPsecVPN vs SSLVPN
項目IPSec VPNSSL VPN
啟始設備投資相同相同
用戶端使用便利性普通佳
使用對象偏重網段(Site to Site)連線遍重個人(Client to Site)連線
遠端用戶環境要安裝VPN軟體IE或其他網頁瀏覽器即可
被認證對象電腦設備使用者
支援軟體各種TCP/IP 應用程式各種Web/client-server應用程式
協定IPSec (Network Layer)SSL (Application Layer)

※詳細比較
項目
適用環境
VPN層次
數據傳輸
客戶端
遠端佈署與管理
管理細緻度
視訊會議
語音會議
設定
NAT
Proxy
FW
IPSec VPN
S2S
網路層
隧道方式
需專用軟體
複雜，成本高
低
容易
不大相容
SSL VPN
Client2S
應用層
SSL傳輸(TCP443)
無須
(提供網頁介面)
簡單，成本低
高
(應用,session層)
複雜
OK



IPSec VPN gateways  are usually implemented on the perimeter firewall, and permit or deny remort host access to  entire private subnets
.
SSL VPN gateways  are usually deployed behind the perimeter firewall, with rules that permit or deny access to appplication services or data.
(In this example, SSL users have access to their own mailboxes on  an intranet Web server.

entry.title: 3 Planes on Router
entry.content:
資料來源https://www.ciscolearningsystem.com (此文章僅為個人學習整理筆記)
此篇文章介紹router上的三種plane功能: Management plane, Control plane, Forwarding plane(又稱date plane)

Management plane: 用來管理
Control plane:
1.負責routing protocols，交換routing information
2.STP

Forwarding plane: 根據FIB傳送data
※FIB (Forwarding Information Base)
router會將RIB資訊更新到成FIB。之後，forwarding plane可透過FIB知道要將packet從哪個port出去
※RIB (Routing Information Base)

entry.title: Switching methods
entry.content:
資料來源https://www.ciscolearningsystem.com (此文章僅為個人學習整理筆記)
此篇文章介紹 cisco router/L3 Switch 的三種switching methods:
觀念：用hardware來記錄cache的模式，速度最快
Cisco RouterL3 Switch(Cisco Catalyst Switch)備註
Process switching software
Fast switchingRoute caching
first packet: software
packets afterward: hardware
Cisco Express Forwarding(default)Topology-based hardware
Fast switching (Route caching)
Route caching is also known as NetFlow LAN switching, flow-based, or demand-based switching, and "route once, switch many.
如何運作
first packet run by CPU; then subsequent packets run by ASIC (Hardware)
Cisco Express Forwarding(Topology-based )
如何運作
在此模式中，router從 ARP table、RIB中將資料更新到FIB上。FIB即為所謂的hardware-based tables。
特點
Per-destination load balancing: 為default configuration，
此模式中，cisco L3 device會讓 host-pair使用同一條線路進去。
缺點: 如果一個網路環境下，太多單一host-pair的傳輸量過大，反而會讓load-balancing失去效果
centralized switching vs. distributed switching (目前理解到此)
在同一個Chasis (big container for modules, usually seen as core device)中，看switching是統一透過route processor by a central forwarding table，還是透過distributed and synchronized cached tables on certain hardware components(向其中一片module)

entry.title: PoE_使用網路線充電
entry.content:
資料來源https://www.ciscolearningsystem.com (此文章僅為個人學習整理筆記)

PSE (Power-sourcing equipment): PoE-able Switch, power injector, Router with PoE-able Switch module
Powered devices: AP, IP phone, surveillance camara

PoE協定
  • Cisco Inline Power (2000)
  • IEEE 802.3af standard (2003)
    1. Up to 15.4 W per port
  • IEEE 802.3at standard (2009) (known as PoE+ or PoE plus)
    1. Up to 25.5 W per port; 50 W and more if using four pairs of wires
    2. Backward-compatible with 802.3af

設定指令
